headers.subject: should we have a twitter button on the website?
headers.x-original-authentication-results: gmr-mx.google.com; spf=neutral (google.com: 217.69.89.162 is neither permitted nor denied by best guess record for domain of hugo@fsfe.org) smtp.mail=hugo@fsfe.org

subject: should we have a twitter button on the website?
text:
Twitter buttons https://twitter.com/about/resources/buttons now offer an
opt-out directly in the widget of tracking. (information about twitter's
tracking: https://support.twitter.com/articles/20169421# and see our
thread https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/tosdr/X6_GxyBSVnE )

I suppose we should not use the Twitter button, because this would
damage our neutrality a little bit, plus it would mean by default we
would impose twitter's button terms to our users even though they might
consider that these terms are unacceptable for them. OTOH Twitter is a
very useful tool to spread a message but I don't think this outweigh our
first concern.
-- 
Hugo Roy 
  French Coordinator, FSFE       chat: hugo@jabber.fsfe.org
  www.fsfe.org/about/roy         mobile: +336 08 74 13 41
                                 mobile DE: +49 151 143 56 563
